description:
Are you ready for your next adventure? 

We are the world's travel platform - our purpose is to bring the world within reach. As one global team, we use the power of technology to knock down the barriers to travel, making it easier, more enjoyable, more attainable and more accessible for millions of travellers around the world, like you. 

We believe that our success stems from building an inclusive and diverse environment, that encourages equality and opportunity based on merit. It shapes our approach to building a company that is truly representative of the modern workforce. 

It’s our goal to ensure continued support for equal opportunities for women across all levels in Australia, including those in technology. We’re relentless in our pursuit to be better – being an Endorsed Employer with WORK180 is our pledge to that. 

As of 2016, women have made up more than half of our workforce across 30 countries. 


Flexible Working Arrangements 

At Expedia Group, we like to make sure that you have a positive work-life balance. We provide both occasional and permanent flexible work arrangements for all our employees globally. This includes the opportunity to work ‘compressed weeks’ (fewer days; longer hours) as well as working from home for the roles that allow this. 

Parental benefits 

Being a parent is a wonderful gift and we support you through this journey. Whether via birth or adoption, we’d like to make sure that the foundations of the bond with your child are nurtured. In Australia, we provide a New Parent Benefits Program that entitles both primary and secondary caregivers to enhanced time-off and paid leave benefits. ​​



Diversity groups 

Our global diversity groups provide a means to connect, support, and celebrate us as a diverse workforce. Our Women at Expedia Learning & Leading (WELL) faction aims to empower and support women to leadership roles at Expedia Group, through professional development courses and networking events. 

Fair talent attraction practices 

At the heart of our talent attraction strategy lies the belief that all qualified candidates deserve equal consideration of employment, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age. To minimize unconscious bias, we ensure a balanced representation amongst interview panellists, and equal representation in recruitment shortlists, where possible.
